description: This document describes the RDFa Vocabulary for Term and Prefix Assignment. The Vocabulary is used to modify RDFaÂ 1.1 processing behavior.
label: RDFa Vocabulary for Term and Prefix Assignment, and for Processor Graph Reporting

PGClass.description: is the top level class of the hierarchy

Pattern.description: Class to identify an (RDF) resource whose properties are to be copied to another resource

PrefixOrTermMapping.description: is the top level class for prefix or term mappings

context.description: provides extra context for the error, eg, http response, an XPointer/XPath information, or simply the URI that created the error

copy.description: identifies the resource (i.e., pattern) whose properties and values should be copied to replace the current triple (retaining the subject of the triple).

prefix.description: defines a prefix mapping for a URI; the value is supposed to be a NMTOKEN

term.description: defines a term mapping for a URI; the value is supposed to be a NMTOKEN

uri.description: defines the URI for either a prefix or a term mapping; the value is supposed to be an absolute URI

usesVocabulary.description: provides a relationship between the host document and a vocabulary defined using the @vocab facility of RDFa1.1

vocabulary.description: defines an absolute URI to be used as a default vocabulary; the value is can be any string; for documentation purposes it is advised to use the string 'true' or 'True'.
